com.teamten.chess

Class Piece

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.teamten.chess.Piece

  • public class Piece
extends Object
    Represents a piece of a type and color.

      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addMoves(Board board, int index, boolean capturesOnly, List<Move> moveList)
      Adds the moves possible by this piece at this position on this board.
      char getAlgebraicCharacter()
      Return the character that can be used to represent this piece in Algebraic Notation.
      char getCharacter()
      Return the character that can be used to represent this piece in ASCII mode.
      String getHtmlCharacter()
      Same as getUnicodeCharacter() but as an HTML entity.
      static Piece getPieceForCharacter(char ch)
      Return the piece that would have returned this from its getCharacter() method.
      static Piece getPieceForTypeAndSide(PieceType pieceType, int side)
      Return the piece for this piece type and side.
      PieceType getPieceType()
      Return the piece type (king, queen, etc) for this piece, or null if an empty square.
      double getPositionBonus(int index)
      Return the position bonus for this piece at this location.
      int getSide()
      Return the side (Side.WHITE or Side.BLACK) for this piece, or 0 if an empty square.
      char getUnicodeCharacter()
      Returns the char for the Unicode character.
      boolean isOtherSide(int otherSide)
      Return whether this piece is from the other side as the specified side.

    • Method Detail

      • getPieceType

        public PieceType getPieceType()
        Return the piece type (king, queen, etc) for this piece, or null if an empty square.

      • getSide

        public int getSide()
        Return the side (Side.WHITE or Side.BLACK) for this piece, or 0 if an empty square.

      • getPositionBonus

        public double getPositionBonus(int index)
        Return the position bonus for this piece at this location.

      • getCharacter

        public char getCharacter()
        Return the character that can be used to represent this piece in ASCII mode.

      • getAlgebraicCharacter

        public char getAlgebraicCharacter()
        Return the character that can be used to represent this piece in Algebraic Notation.

      • getUnicodeCharacter

        public char getUnicodeCharacter()
        Returns the char for the Unicode character. See http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chess_symbols_in_Unicode

      • getHtmlCharacter

        public String getHtmlCharacter()
        Same as getUnicodeCharacter() but as an HTML entity.

      • addMoves

        public void addMoves(Board board,
                     int index,
                     boolean capturesOnly,
                     List<Move> moveList)
        Adds the moves possible by this piece at this position on this board.

      • isOtherSide

        public boolean isOtherSide(int otherSide)
        Return whether this piece is from the other side as the specified side. Empty squares are never on the other side.

      • toString

        public String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class Object

      • getPieceForCharacter

        public static Piece getPieceForCharacter(char ch)
        Return the piece that would have returned this from its getCharacter() method.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if none is found.

      • getPieceForTypeAndSide

        public static Piece getPieceForTypeAndSide(PieceType pieceType,
                                           int side)
        Return the piece for this piece type and side.
